posts._title: Christian-Jaque – Les bonnes causes AKA Don’t Tempt the Devil (1963)
posts.title: Les bonnes causes
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:‘Paul Dupré dies at the hands of his nurse Gina Bianchi when she administers his daily injection. His wife Catherine accuses the nurse of murdering her husband but Gina insists that she is innocent. Realising she too is a suspect, Catherine asks her lawyer, Charles Cassidi, to defend her as Judge Albert Gaudet starts his …

posts.title: Calcutta
posts.excerpt: Dennis Schwartz writes:John Farrow’s Calcutta is a fast-paced old-fashioned adventure yarn, shot entirely in Paramount’s backlot. Seton Miller does the screenplay. It’s an entertaining potboiler, though a minor work … Ladd gives an icy action-hero performance as someone who revels in his disdain for women as untrustworthy companions. By Ladd’s politically incorrect moves, he takes …

posts.title: Carnal Knowledge (1971)
posts.excerpt: Quote:The concurrent sexual lives of best friends Jonathan and Sandy are presented, those lives which are affected by the sexual mores of the time and their own temperament, especially in relation to the respective women who end up in their lives. Their story begins in the late 1940s when they are roommates attending Amherst College …

posts._title: Zhangke Jia – Jiang hu er nv AKA Ash Is Purest White (2018) (HD)
posts.title: Jiang hu er nv
posts.excerpt: Set in China’s underworld, this tale of love and betrayal follows Qiao, a dancer who fires a few warning shots during a fight and then, after lying to protect her gangster lover Bin from a long prison sentence, ends up in jail herself. posts._title: Josef Aichholzer & Ruth Beckermann – Wien retour AKA Return to Vienna (1983)
posts.title: Wien retour
posts.excerpt: Franz West (1909-85) remembers his youth in Vienna: the variety of the Jewish population of the so called Matzah-Island, his commitment to the worker’s movement of the Red Vienna and the rise of Austro-fascism and National Socialism. West’s masterly narration combined with impressing archive footage illustrate and elucidate the complex Austrian history between WW1 and …

posts._title: Armando Robles Godoy – En la selva no hay estrellas aka No stars in the jungle (1967)
posts.title: En la selva no hay estrellas
posts.excerpt: allmovie:A treasure hunter tries to transport a cache of gold belonging to a tribal queen from the Amazon jungle in this routine adventure. Customs of the local natives and the hero’s life in the city are thrown in, but the main focus is his attempt to move the heavy gold from the dangerous and exotic …

posts._title: Julio Medem – La pelota vasca AKA The Basque Ball: Skin Against Stone (2003)
posts.title: La pelota vasca
posts.excerpt: Allmovie.comAcclaimed Spanish filmmaker Julio Medem turns toward nonfiction to direct the documentary La Pelota Vasca: La Piel Contra la Piedra (The Basque Ball: Skin Against Stone). This controversial film is a look at the complicated situation between the Basque nationalist movement and the Spanish government. Medem interviews politicians, novelists, musicians, and over 70 other commentators …

posts.title: La Paloma
posts.excerpt: Quote:When you play with clichés, you have to be very careful that they don’t backfire; the little things have a way of maiming almost everything around them. Daniel Schmid’s “La Paloma” — which was shown last night and to be repeated tonight at the New York Film Festival — is intentionally crammed with cultural chestnuts, …
